intro: Hieracium pyrrhanthes, commonly known as the red-hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and often have a reddish tinge, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive red center. Hieracium pyrrhanthes is an herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
